content: The "Church Health Plan Act of 2013" may be cited as the Church Health Plan Act. Church plans are recognized as qualified health plans under this Act. The Church Health Plan Act of 2013 recognizes qualified church plans as qualified health plans under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. Qualified church plans must meet specific requirements outlined in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Church Health Plan Act of 2013 recognizes qualified church plans as qualified health plans under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. These plans must provide health care coverage for employees of ten or more eligible common law employers, with a majority of employees being from churches or qualified church-controlled organizations. Additionally, the Act prohibits exclusions based on preexisting conditions or other health status, prohibits discrimination against individual participants and beneficiaries based on health status for enrollment purposes, and limits the ratio of incurred losses plus loss adjustment expenses to earned premiums. The Church Health Plan Act of 2013 recognizes qualified church plans as qualified health plans under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. These plans must provide health care coverage for employees of ten or more eligible common law employers, with a majority of employees being from churches or qualified church-controlled organizations. Additionally, qualified church plans are excluded from participating in American Health Benefit Exchanges. The Secretary shall not assess charges or make payments to a qualified church plan for actuarial risk under section 1343. Qualified church plans are exempt from subsidies, payments, or requirements that apply to qualified health plans on American Health Benefit Exchanges, except for premium differentiation methods consistent with the Secretary's assessment criteria. The Secretary assesses charges and payments to qualified health plans based on actuarial risks of enrollees, including those of qualified church plans. Additional methods and criteria can be developed by qualified church plans to account for actuarial risk, as long as they align with the risk adjusters described in section 1343. Qualified church plans are deemed to be minimum essential coverage under an eligible employer-sponsored plan and equivalent to a health plan offered through an American Health Benefit Exchange. Employers participating in qualified church plans are subject to specific regulations. Employers in qualified church plans with up to 25 full-time equivalent employees and average annual wages exceeding twice a certain amount are considered eligible small employers under section 45R(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Any employer participating in a qualified church plan shall not exclude from wages and other compensation for any individual receiving premium tax credits under section 1401. An individual receiving minimum essential coverage under a qualified church plan shall be deemed to satisfy the premium tax credits and reductions in cost-sharing. Employers participating in qualified church plans are considered 'religious employers' and shall not exclude any individual receiving premium tax credits under section 1401. Individuals under a church plan are considered to meet individual responsibility requirements and qualify for premium tax credits if their household income falls within a certain range. They are also eligible for reductions in cost-sharing. Individuals eligible for reductions in cost-sharing under section 1402(b) if their household income is between 100-400 percent of the poverty line. Regulations will ensure small employers offering qualified church plans receive the same tax credit as others under section 45R of the Internal Revenue Code. The text chunk discusses ensuring that individuals receiving minimum essential coverage under a qualified church plan receive the same premium tax credit and reduction in cost-sharing as other eligible individuals. Church plans are given sufficient opportunity to transition to meet the qualified church plan definition. The amendments made by this Act regarding church plans shall take effect as part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
